### Additional Information

thanks for logging, I'll see if i can reproduce this now.

There was another ticket raised that was similar, but the syncing seemed to resolve once they got different clients, so hopefully I get to see this one...

When you say crash, do you mean the sync stalls or the JVM actually exits?  A `NullPointerException` shouldn't cause the JVM to exit.  In fact, that error is being reported at debug level because `FetchBlockTask` is handling it correctly - the block request will be retried and that shouldn't affect sync at all.

It's been a while, not sure what caused the exit. I also hit a few memory problems, some related to bad setup (MiB vs MB memory limit configuration, different limits of docker and java not matching), as well as relatively high memory usage for what is otherwise a small machine. If you can catch the reason for the nil pointer that would be great, but I think the crash shortly after might have been docker shutting it down. Will soon re-deploy my teku nodes with more memory, and do a fresh sync.

Ok, we did catch the `NullPointerException` and handled it as expected - it would have been completely unseen at the default log level but is included at DEBUG level to explain why the block wasn't fetched on that try.

Will close this for now since there's been a lot of memory usage improvements since and we don't have the actual cause for the crash to investigate further.  Feel free to reopen if it happens again.
